document_data.name: Crumblecake
document_data.location: [[Swinging Sword]] and [[Blackbutter Inn]], [[Red Larch]]{{Cite dragon+/1/Travel Talk: The Dessarin River Valley}}
document_data.mainbody:
'''Crumblecake''' was a moist loaf from the town of [[Red Larch]] in the [[Dessarin Valley]], in [[northwest Faer√ªn]], made from nuts, chickpea mash, chopped roots and greens, turkey, and wildfowl scraps, and then baked together.

When ordering a crumblecake in an inn, they were often served with strong sauces, and usually with fried onions.
document_data.Reception: It was said to have health benefits, but it was not regarded as a "tasty" dish.
document_data.History:
Around [[1360 DR]], a crumblecake was sold for between one and three copper pieces depending on the size and quality.

As of [[1489 DR]], it was known to be served at the [[Swinging Sword]] and the [[Blackbutter Inn]] in Red Larch, and ingredients were often sourced from a nearby walled abbey with farms, named [[Goldenfields]].
